description.p: Dragon-Kin are humanoids who carry draconic blood not as a distant echo, but as a living inheritance. Unlike dragonborn, whose lineage manifests uniformly, Dragon-Kin display their heritage in varied and personal waysâ€”through antler-like horns, patches of shimmering scales, and tails that move with deliberate balance.

Their draconic ancestry is ancient rather than immediate. At some point deep within their lineage, a dragon became bound to a mortal bloodline through means long lost to history. Once established, this inheritance does not fade or dilute over generations. A Dragon-Kin family remains draconic indefinitely, which is both the source of their power and the reason for their rarity.
Though uncommon, Dragon-Kin often integrate seamlessly into the cultures they inhabit, identifying more with the societies that raised them than with any unified Dragon-Kin culture.
Ability Score Increase. Increase two different ability scores of your choice by 1.
Size. Medium.
Speed. 30 feet.
Languages. Common and Draconic.
Darkvision. Darkvision 30 ft. Advantage on sight-based Wisdom (Perception) checks.
Draconic Will. Advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.
Draconic Insight. Choose two skills: Perception, Nature, Survival, or Insight.
Cultural Adaptation. Choose a tool proficiency or one extra language.
Draconic Expression. Choose one: Great Wings, Draconic Magic, or Great Horns.
Draconic Color. Choose one draconic color (sets your draconic damage type).
Increase two different ability scores of your choice by 1.

sheet.description: Increase two ability scores by 1 (choose twice).

description.p: You have darkvision out to 30 feet. In addition, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

sheet.description: Darkvision 30 ft. Advantage on sight-based Perception checks.

description.p: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

sheet.description: Advantage on saving throws vs charmed and frightened.

description.p: You gain proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: Perception, Nature, Survival, or Insight.

sheet.description: Choose two skills: Perception, Nature, Survival, or Insight.

description.p: You can manifest your wings to gain a flying speed of 30 feet for a total of 10 minutes per day. These minutes can be used all at once or in shorter increments (no action required). You regain expended minutes when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Fly speed 30 ft for up to 10 minutes per long rest (track minutes spent).

description.p: As an action, you release a pulse of draconic energy in a 15-foot radius centered on yourself. Each creature of your choice in the area takes 2d4 damage (type = your Draconic Color). Uses: 2 per short rest. Damage increases by 1d4 at 5th, 10th, and 15th level.

sheet.description: 15-ft radius pulse; creatures you choose take 2d4 damage (type = your draconic color). +1d4 at 5th/10th/15th.

description.p: When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you can use your reaction to gain the benefits of absorb elements. Uses: 2 per long rest.

sheet.description: Reaction: gain the benefits of absorb elements when you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage.

description.p: You gain proficiency with one tool of your choice.
You learn one additional language of your choice.
